result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. NICHOLAS N GONZALES

defendant.name: GONZALES, NICHOLAS N

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:09 PM Defendant NICHOLAS N GONZALES in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Kapelis appeared by video for NICHOLAS N GONZALES.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes the is waiving his right to a prelim. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court and states it mirrors the criminal complaint. Attorney Kapelis acknowledges receipt of the information, waives any reading and confirms it mirrors the criminal complaint. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant on all counts. Court will set for Return Date December 5, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 1:11 PM.
Return date scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return date on December 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

9:10 AM Defendant NICHOLAS N GONZALES in court, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson appeared by video for NICHOLAS N GONZALES.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Nelson confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court notes bond has been set. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. 

Court adjourned at 9:11 AM

Court will set for Preliminary Hearing September 28, 2022 at 1:00 PM.
Initial appearance on September 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.

3:02 PM Defendant NICHOLAS N GONZALES appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Scott Nelson by video for NICHOLAS N GONZALES.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant on address, phone number, and employment. Statement by DA Laspisa. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Atty Nelson states defendant does qualify for the public defender. Atty Nelson makes bond recommendation. Court orders bond at $1,500 cash bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
